Under this Act, insures women workers get sickness benefit, disablement benefit, medical benefit and funeral expenses along with insured men workers. However, in addition to these benefits, insured women workers also het maternity benefit in case of contingencies arising out of the pregnancy, confinement, miscarriage and death.


 This act provided a scheme under which the employe and the employee must contribute a certain percentage of the monthly wage to the Insurance Corporation that runs dispensaries and hospitals in working class locaties. It facilitates both outpatient and in-patient care and freely dispenses medicines and covers hospitalization needs and costs. 

 Employment injury, including occupational disease is compensated according to a a schedule of rates proportionate to the extent of injury and loss of earning capacity.
